abstract: Federal regulators plan to announce on Friday a legal settlement with executives over their roles in an accounting scandal that surfaced in 2004.
snippet: Federal regulators plan to announce on Friday a legal settlement with executives over their roles in an accounting scandal that surfaced in 2004.
lead_paragraph: Federal regulators plan to announce on Friday a legal settlement with Franklin D. Raines, the former chief executive of Fannie Mae, and two other former executives of the giant mortgage company over their roles in an accounting scandal that surfaced in 2004, according to people close to the negotiations.

headline.main: Ex-Fannie Mae Executives Said to Be Near Settlement
headline.print_headline: Ex-Fannie Mae Executives Said to Be Near Settlement

abstract: Federal regulators plan to announce on Friday a legal settlement with Franklin D. Raines, the former chief executive of Fannie Mae, and two other former executives of the giant mortgage company over their roles in an accounting scandal that surfaced in 2004, according to The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Federal regulators plan to announce on Friday a legal settlement with Franklin D. Raines, the former chief executive of Fannie Mae, and two other former executives of the giant mortgage company over their roles in an accounting scandal that surfaced in 2004, according to The New York Times.

headline.main: Ex-Fannie Mae Executives Said to Be Near Settlement
